page.title: 06Education, Gipsey Bridge
page.content: The school in Gipsey Bridge was set up about 150 years ago.It served the population of Langrick, Gipsey Bridge, and Wildmore.Before this time the land was marsh and only a few people lived here.At the moment there are 27 children in the school and there are two teachers although at one time there were more than 100 pupils and a larger staff.The main school is now used by the infants with one room for the school hall while the juniors are taught in a mobile classroom in the school grounds. The school house is now used as staffroom ,office and store. The pupils enter this school at the age of almost 5 and leave when they are eleven at which time they go to William Lovell Secondary Modern School or to Horncastle Grammar school.
